result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Debaron Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Debaron Anderson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's pro se request for Huber privileges.  Filed in 14CM4203.
Signed, Filed, and Distributed; Order denying defendant's motion for release privileges/additional release privileges.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Hon. Janet C. Protasiewicz, Br. 24, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request for Huber privileges.

AS TO COUNT 2
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, straight time. Court stayed the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS. 

Conditions of Probation:
-No contact with any Walmart stores.
-AODA assessment and comply with recommended treatment. 
-Absolute sobriety to be monitored with random drug screens. 
-Mental Health assessments and comply with recommended treatment. 
-Maintain full time employment and/or school. 
-DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge.
-Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges, to be paid during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  

Filed, 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Christopher Debaron Anderson in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Christopher Debaron Anderson in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered count 1 Dismissed, But Read In. 

AS TO COUNT 2
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.
Due to court congestion case adjourned for 08-28-2015 at 08:30 am.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Christopher Debaron Anderson not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant was not produced.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Christopher Debaron Anderson not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher Debaron Anderson in court with attorney Paul Manley for Colin P. McGinn.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pretrial conference conducted.  Defendant has another pending matter before this court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Christopher Debaron Anderson in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Christopher Debaron Anderson in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
